goal.core.mentalstate

Class BeliefBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.mentalstate.BeliefBase

  • public class BeliefBase
extends java.lang.Object

    A belief base is a Database with generic handling and querying capabilities.

    The theory represents the "visible" contents of the belief base. It should correspond with the database, except possibly for background knowledge present in the database which is not reflected in the theory. In order to ensure the theory corresponds correctly in this sense with the database, any changes to the belief base need to be made by using the methods provided by this class. By directly modifying the underlying database, the correspondence may be lost. Background knowledge added to the database is assumed to be static. Additionally, the predicates declared/defined in the belief base's theory and in background theories should not overlap (this will raise exceptions when inserting the background knowledge into a Prolog database).

    A BeliefBase is observable; observers are notified whenever the contents of the BeliefBase have changed. (For example after a successful 'insert' call)

    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Constructor Detail

      • BeliefBase

        public BeliefBase(BASETYPE baseType,
          KRlanguage language,
          java.util.Set<DatabaseFormula> content,
          AgentId owner,
          AgentId agentName)
           throws KRInitFailedException

        Constructs a belief base of a certain BASETYPE, creates the corresponding database maintained by the KR layer, and initializes it with given content.

        The knowledge, beliefs, mails, and percepts of an agent are stored in BeliefBases. Goals are handled by GoalBases.

        Parameters:
        baseType - The type of this BeliefBase. Should be either BASETYPE.KNOWLEDGEBASE, BASETYPE.BELIEFBASE, BASETYPE.MAILBOX, or BASETYPE.PERCEPTBASE.
        language - The KR language used for representing the contents of this belief base and creating the corresponding KR database.
        content - The content to be inserted into the database that is created.
        owner - The name of the agent that owns this BeliefBase.
        agentName - The name of the agent whose beliefs, etc are represented using this belief base.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - If the KR technology failed to create and/or initialize a new database.

        public final java.util.Set<Substitution> query(Query formula,
                                Debugger debugger)
        Performs a query on the belief base and returns a non-empty set of substitutions if the query succeeds.
        Parameters:
        formula - The query.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        a set of substitutions each of which make the query true, or an empty set otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Update update,
             Debugger debugger)
        See #update(List, List, SteppingDebugger). Deleting an Update is calling update with the add and delete lists reversed.
        Parameters:
        update - The update to be processed.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the updating.
        Returns:
        true if anything changed; false otherwise.

      • update

        public boolean update(java.util.List<DatabaseFormula> addList,
             java.util.List<DatabaseFormula> deleteList,
             Debugger debugger)
        Deletes the formulas in the delete list and adds the formulas in the add list to this BeliefBase. First removes and then adds, so any formulas that appear in both lists will result in adding the formula if it is not already present.
        Parameters:
        addList - The 'add' list of formulas that are to be inserted.
        deleteList - The 'delete' list of formulas that are to be removed.
        debugger - The SteppingDebugger monitoring the updating.
        Returns:
        true if anything changed; false otherwise.

      • updatePercepts

        public void updatePercepts(java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> addList,
                  java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> deleteList,
                  Debugger debugger)
        Inserts new content (the addList into the percept base and removes old content (the deleteList) from the percept base.
        Parameters:
        addList - The set of facts to be added. (The parameter is called addList for historical reasons.)
        deleteList - The set of facts to be deleted. (The parameter is called deleteList for historical reasons.)
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the call.
